meanings.definition: An aromatic or pungent substance used to flavor food.
meanings.sent1: I added a sprinkle of spice to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a variety of spices to enhance the taste of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat knocked over the spice rack, creating a fragrant mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a spice that seasoned the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the spice filled the kitchen, making mouths water.

meanings.definition: To add zest, interest, or excitement to something.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to spice up the party with some fun games.
meanings.sent2: The comedian tried to spice his routine with new jokes.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist really spiced up the movie.
meanings.sent4: His adventurous spirit spiced up their mundane routine.
meanings.sent5: The dance performance was spiced with energetic moves.
